glsa.title: git: git-daemon Denial of Service
glsa.synopsis: An error in git-daemon might lead to a Denial of Service via resource consumption.

background.p: git - the stupid content tracker, the revision control system used by the Linux kernel team.

description.p: Shawn O. Pearce reported that git-daemon runs into an infinite loop when handling requests that contain unrecognized arguments.

impact.p: A remote unauthenticated attacker could send a specially crafted request to git-daemon, possibly leading to a Denial of Service (CPU consumption).

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All git users should upgrade to the latest version:
